教學目標:   
In the first semester, students will learn and practice basic skills of public speaking such as opening a speech, building points to support main themes, and ending a speech.  Students will be able to learn how to organize different types of speech.  In addition, students will be able to evaluate other\`s speeches.

Explanation of assignments:  

**Homework explanation:**

You will organize a group of 3 to complete your assignments in this class.  Each week, there will be an assignment for your group to work on and present in the next class. 

A:  Self-introduction:  Try to find information on what makes a self-introduction effective.  You may use your own experience or information from text or from internet to come up with tips on effective self-introduction.  In addition, each student will prepare a 90 second self-introduction to the class.

B:  Audience analysis:  What is audience analysis?  What type of information do you need to collect?  Why is it important to collect information on audience?  In what ways will audience influence a speech?

C:  Method of support:  What are the different methods of support when you are giving a talk?  Find examples and explain them.

D:  Organization:  How do you organize your speech structure?  What are some important elements you need to consider?  Why are these elements important?

E:  Delivery:  Find tips on effective delivery in speech.  Delivery here refers to language used and visual aid used.

F:  Informative speech:  What is an informative speech?  How do you make an effective informative speech?

F1:  Each person will be assigned a topic in making an informative speech of 10 minutes.

G:  Persuasive speech?  What is a persuasive speech?  What are the different methods of persuasion?  How do you make an effective persuasive speech?

G1:  Each person will be assigned a topic in making an effective persuasive speech of 10 minutes.

**Critical Evaluation:**

Each class, students will be asked to evaluate each other’s presentation.  This will count as a part of your grade in this class.

methodologies.note: Students will be able to help each other with their speeches.  They will also be assigned groups to search for information as a preview to the class.
